home.title: HomeLab
home.description: Welcome to HomeLab. A YSWS where you ship projects related to having a self hosted server at home, and we ship things to help you create your own setup (or update a setup you already have!)

faqs.What is HomeLab?: HomeLab is a Hack Club YSWS program where you ship projects related to having a self hosted server at home, and we ship things to help you create your own setup (or update a setup you already have!)
faqs.When does it start and end?: HomeLab has started already if you are reading this! Start tracking time. The deadline for projects to be submitted is the 31st of January 2026 11:59PM (EST).
faqs.What is classified as a home server rela:
We are fairly open to this, however creating a random project that is "hosted on a home server" doesn't count. This means you can't build an unrelated website and just claim you can host it on a home server. Instead, ideas include a website that lets you automate tasks and processes on your network, a file explorer based on storage on a NAS, etc. You could also do a hardware project such as a 3d printed server rack.
Please note, setting up and hosting something including just editing a config does not count.
faqs.How many projects can I make?: You can make as many project as you would like, as well as contribute them all to your hour total to spend on rewards. Rewards pretty much work like a shop balance where your hours are you balance, and you can buy any amount of things.
faqs.Are there any requirements for participa: You must be YSWS eligible (18 years or under) and a participant of Hack Club.
faqs.Is HomeLab free?: Yes! HomeLab is a Hack Club program and completely free to participate. Find out more at hackclub.com.
faqs.Can I double dip?: No, you cannot double dip with other YSWS programs.
faqs.Is there a minimum hour requirement and: Each project submitted must have at least 3 hours tracked towards it using hackatime.hackclub.com. Projects must also be in a working and shippable state.
faqs.Can I use AI?: AI coding can be used for at most 20% of the code written. All readmes must also be human written.
faqs.What are the requirements for submitting:
- Project on a GitHub repo with frequent commits (at least 1 every 4 hours, if not your hours may be reduced!)
- Project has tracked at least 3 hours.
- Project is written with not more than 20% of AI
- You have a working and live demo. (for hardware this can be a picture or video, they must be physically made)

rewards.title: HomeLab Grant
rewards.description: Use on most things homelab related (ask in #home-lab)!

rewards.title: 2x 32gb Flash Drive
rewards.description: perfect to install server software on
